title: Descent (Born Abroad)
description: Parents with United States citizenship can confer their citizenship on their child born abroad conditional on the continuous residency status of the parents.

title: Birth in Country
description: Children can acquire United States citizenship based on birth within the U.S. or outlying territories regardless of the citizenship and birthplace of their parents.

title: Establishment of Parentage
description: A person born to a United States citizen who establishes such parentage after birth can acquire U.S. citizenship.

title: Residence Based Acquisition
description: A person with established legal permanent residency in the United States may acquire U.S. citizenship under certain conditions.

title: Very Long Residence
description: A person over the age of 50 or 55 living in the United States for a total period of at least 20 or 15 years may be granted U.S. citizenship.

title: Marriage
description: A person who has been the spouse of a United States citizen and a U.S. resident for 3 years and shares a common household with such spouse may be granted U.S. citizenship.

title: Adoption
description: Minors (under the age of 18) adopted by United States citizens are granted U.S. citizenship.

title: Public Service
description: A legal permanent resident who has served in the armed forces for a total period of at least 1 year, served in the armed forces during military hostilities, or made an extraordinary contribution to the national security of the United States may be granted U.S. citizenship.

title: Foundlings
description: Children of unknown parentage under the age of 5 found within the United States or outlying territories are granted U.S. citizenship.
